Coach: Performance management is about:
• Managing individual performance, and
• Managing team performance

Recruitment, selection, and performance planning and measurement are the key activities expected from you as a Sales Manager along with adhering to the defined sales process.

The majority of performance management will be about managing the performance of individuals within your team. Over time, you will notice that there is a process to follow, which is a continuous cycle

For each life insurance professional in your team, you need to:
1. Make a fair and objective assessment of each individual’s current performance.
2. Conduct effective individual one-to-one meetings to give feedback and agree on appropriate development targets.
3. Deliver the appropriate coaching required to help the life insurance professional improve performance.
4. Monitor and review the improvements the life insurance professional is making on an individual basis.

Managing performance should be a partnership between you and each life insurance professional to help him or her get better at what they do.

There will be times when you will find common development needs for your team members. There are two ways of dealing with these needs:
1. By conducting specific training sessions, which build the skills and knowledge of your life insurance professionals, and
2. By holding regular team meetings, which provide an opportunity to recognise top performers and motivate them. Team meetings also provide a platform for sharing information and best practices.

Performance management allows you to set, agree on and review targets for development.
